name: pinMode()
content:
Set the mode of an individual pin.

Pins on the board can be used for either digital output, digital input, or analog input. Setting the pin mode of a pin determines how it will be used in the program.

examples.name: Red LED on
examples.description: Set the pin of the red LED to output and turn it on.

palette_params.name: pin
palette_params.description: The number of the pin you want to change. This is usually printed on your board, but can also be found in your board's documentation.

palette_params.name: mode
palette_params.description:
The mode that this pin will be set to. Must be one of
* "input"
* "output"
* "analog"

short_description: Set the mode of an individual pin.
tips:
* Not all pins can be used in every mode. Refer to your board's documentation for details.
* On prewired boards, such as the Circuit Playground, you may not be able to change the mode of pins that are already defined.
